Maybe I over-did it, but I'm very happy and think I'll get another pair and leave them as-is. These are used in many studios and will be a great addition to your collection. Check it out, Jodi Foster uses them as a radio host in the movie, The Brave One. ... They are comfortable, reliable, and it doesn't take a lot of power to drive them. marcifer expand » « collapse

I work in the film business and took a survey from sound mixers/recordists and they all suggested these as the workhorse of the industry. I purchased them and I am very happy with what I hear. It turns out my wife who is a singer and radio host also prefers them to my other headphones and I can never find them. I am happily buying another pair fortunately they are affordable.

I just came out of a sound mixing studio session. The engineers had them as well. That has to say something. For the cost / sound and comfort, I've yet to come across a better pair of headphone. Only downside is the pads might come apart 2 years in. But that's 100 of hours later...

I've had my set of the Sony 7506's for about a month now, Definitely happy with the sound, from highs to low end. I use them for editing music videos, watching movies and hooked to my IPod. All applications work great! Movie soundtracks seem to have an almost surround quality to them using these headphones.... definately NOT just left right and center sounding! I have a rather large head and ears and I found that these phones were hurting the edges of my ears a LOT! I adjusted/bent the very malleable headband and that helped a lot. I also ordered and installed the Beyerdynamic Padded Earcushions for DT250/DT280 offered here. Would HIGHLY recommend switching out the ear pads. WAY more comfortable and seemingly a bit tighter bass!
I bought these to up-grade from the set that comes standard, which are just ok. These make it so that I can mix sound for hours without my ears aching and are totally worth the extra 20 bucks I paid

I've listened to music, voice-overs, film clips and yes, absolutely nothing with these headphones for 6 years now. They are nothing short of pure transparent sound - all I need in a headphone. I'm a picky listener, too. There have been times when the music runs out and I just keep wearing the headphones. They are very comfortable and block out a lot of office noise without being fancy noise-reducing headphones. My only gripe is that they smash my hair like any fitted phone would, so half the time I wear them around the back of my head resting on my neck, which works fine. I love them and would buy them again in a heartbeat for much more money.

Hi everyone, I'm starting to build my home studio..so I need it to buy a Good headphone so I choose the Sony mdr-7506.. I don't regret it at all ..sound great .. for instruments,vocals.. The only things that I wish they came with a case or something not only the leather bag... but anyway its great.. I also saw other mdr-7506 on other websites but many of them are Chinese fake...with very low prices so ..watch out! I rather buy on a place where they guaranty the product... Well bottom line I recommend the Sony MDR-7506 to any musician on the way to glory!

i use these headphones to listen to my i-pod and do music assignments on Smart Music(music program). the sound is amazing, and the headphones muffle noise but don't completely block it out. making it useful for anyone who needs your attention. the fact that these headphones can also fold into a small bag is great for storage, and for finding them easily. the only small problem is the length of the cord, whenever i'm listening to my i-pod i have to stuff the cord in a pocket otherwise i can trip on it.

These legendary headphones are a great but for anyone in the audio industry. The only problem I have seen is the ring on the mini plug tends to disconnect, leaving you with signal only in the left phone. Easily repairable with a new mini plug. Also, the wires in the cord are notorious for breaking. Once again, due to the great user-serviceable design, just swap it out. Overall great design, beats the hell out of the competition.

This is my first pro monitor headphone that I use for my video works. I will never go back to using consumer grade hifi headphone for sound monitoring when shooting video! Awesome sound quality. It is very comfortable on the ears for extended use. Audio is an important part of video work. MDR 7506 has quality sound performance without break your bank account for any videographer.

Bought these to replace MDR-7509 headphones. The MDR-7509s seem to have an earpiece diaphram coating which changes rigidity with use. Takes about 30 minutes daily operation to loosen them up to acceptable distortion for use. The MDR-7506s do not have this problem. Much better audio with the MDR-7506s. However, the MDR-7506s ear pads rest on the outer edges of my ears and are uncomfortable. They are too small for my ears. The MDR-7509 ear pads are larger and fit around my ears. I had expected the MDR-7506 ear pads to be as large as the MDR-7509s. So I have another item for my junk box. The MDR-7506s would be fine for a person with small ears.

Item.ReviewTitle: Great replacement for my Sony MDR-7506
Item.Review: Just as all the other reviews have said, these are great replacements/upgrades for your cans. Smooth and reduces sweaty-ear syndrom. A little patience is recommended for putting them on, but fit fine once they're on.

My MDR-7506 are over ten years old, and now made new again with these cushions. They look and feel way better, thanks to the velour cushions. The material that actually touches your skin is way nicer than that awful plastic. The best part, however, is the shape and material of the padding. It is a little more firm than the cheap yellow foam that Sony provides. They are also a bit deeper and maybe slightly beleveld to provide a larger diameter where it touches your head. With the old pads, the phones were always partially ON my ear, and hurt after longer listening periods. These pads fit fully AROUND my ear, and the overall experience with these headphones is twice as good. So if I had to get a new pair of Sony phones, I would replace the pads immediately. Hint: use a butter knife ... to install the lip of the cover onto the earpiece. Took 3 minutes. expand » « collapse

I use these headphones running sound during live productions. They work great!!! I also use them during my down time to listen to my mp3 WOW what a great sound, heard things didn't know were there... Great frequency response...

Item.ReviewTitle: A great product for a great price.
Item.Review: I use the headphones for my computer at work, as well my computer at home. I needed something with great sound that was light weight. I would wear headphones for hours and be uncomfortable at many points in the day, now with my MDR i really don't have that issue, especially with the deluxe pads.

Item.ReviewTitle: My MDR-V6 headphones are alive again!
Item.Review: These Padded Ear cushions brought life back into my MDR-V6. Owned MDR-V6 headphones for over 20 years. The original pads had deteriorated, thereby reducing sound quality. Excellent fit for MDR-V6 headphones! Now I hear deeper bass and crisper mid range and treble. Highly Recommended! Thanks to those who suggested these fantastic replacements.

These are amazing earphones, so good that I swear my audio track quality has improved just because of the clarity of the sound while I'm shooting. I now see why they have become legendary. I do have one gripe; the cord is WAY too long for my liking. It must be 12' when uncoiled. As I'm monitoring off the video camera, 2 feet would be ample. I wish the cord could be interchanged easily.

Pros: Durable; Compact; Clear Sound
This is my 3rd pair of these headphones. My first pair lasted 15 years, the second was permanently borrowed by my children & so I have my own for use in the studio for my radio show. In this business we have plenty of great options but hands down these Sony headphones produce a clean and clear sound.

Went through two sets of ear cushions for my Sony MDR V6. Coating kept on deteriorating. These replacements fit right on. Although sometimes not shown in product pictures, they come with separate center inserts to span the open space in the ear cushions. They seal out outside sound and are very comfortable.

Pros: I love the sound these headphones produce. I'm a musician and I've used quality headphones all my life. I usually spend $150-$225 for new headphones every 5 years or so. At almost half the cost, imagine my surprise when I discovered these HP's have a much broader range of sounds than my old Sony HPhones. Great Headphones at a very reasonable price.Comes with a nice long coiled cord, as always with Sony.Cons: The ear cup is a little smaller than my previous 4 or 5 Sony Headphones. These are comfortable, but they do not 'enclose' my ears, instead, they kind of sit 'on' my ears.
